any plant from the genus (= group of related plants) Dianthus. There are many different types of dianthus, including carnation and pink: In similar dry conditions, dianthus are ideal. Winter winds can dry out the evergreen leaves of perennials such as coral bells and dianthus. See also
carnation
pink
sweet william
More examplesFewer examplesAll dianthus need propagating regularly as they become less vigorous after three years.The colour pink is thought to be named after the pink dianthus flower, which was first recorded in the 17th century.Dianthus are the miniature member of the carnation family with light clove-like or nutmeg scent.
